  <div style="text-align: left;">[[TableOfContents|Table of Contents]] | [[Installing_and_Running_Doradus|Previous]] | [[Embedding_Doradus_In_Another_Application|Next]] | [[Index|Index]]</div>
  <div style="color: #999999; font-family: sans-serif; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left;">
    <span>[[Installing_and_Running_Doradus|Installing and Running Doradus]]</span> : Running Doradus Stand-Alone</div>
  <hr />
  <div style="color: #345A8A; font-family: &quot;Museo For Dell Regular&quot;; font-size: 13pt; font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 12pt; margin-top: 12pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0YP0HA">Running Doradus Stand-Alone</span></div>
  <div style="font-family: &quot;Museo Sans For Dell Regular&quot;; font-size: 11pt; margin-bottom: 12pt; margin-top: 12pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0XP0HA">Doradus can be run as a console application with a script in the </span><span style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal;">{doradus_home}/bin</span> directory such as this:</div>
  <div style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; margin-bottom: 12pt; margin-left: 18pt; margin-top: 12pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0WP0HA">java -cp "../lib/*:../config/*" com.dell.doradus.core.DoradusServer</span></div>
  <div style="font-family: &quot;Museo Sans For Dell Regular&quot;; font-size: 11pt; margin-bottom: 12pt; margin-top: 12pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0VP0HA">This is assumes Java 1.7 is visible in the script’s </span><span style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal;">path</span>. The files <span style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal;">doradus.yaml</span> and <span style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal;">log4j.properties</span> must be visible in the JVM’s resource path, although their location can be set with the JVM defines <span style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal;">-Ddoradus.config</span> and <span style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal;">-Dlog4j.configuration</span> respectively. Example:</div>
  <div style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; margin-bottom: 12pt; margin-left: 18pt; margin-top: 12pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0UP0HA">java -Dlog4j.configuration=file:/Doradus/mylog4j.properties \<br />	-Ddoradus.config=file:/Doradus/mydoradus.yaml \<br />	...</span></div>
  <div style="font-family: &quot;Museo Sans For Dell Regular&quot;; font-size: 11pt; margin-bottom: 12pt; margin-top: 12pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0TP0HA">Most </span><span style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal;">doradus.yaml</span> parameters can be overridden with command line arguments by prepending a "-" to the parameter name. For example, <span style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal;">doradus.yaml</span> defines <span style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal;">restport: 1123</span>, which sets the REST API listening port number. To override this to 5711, add the command line argument:</div>
  <div style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; margin-bottom: 12pt; margin-left: 18pt; margin-top: 12pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0SP0HA">java -cp "../lib/*:../config/*" com.dell.doradus.core.DoradusServer </span><span style="font-weight: bold;">-restport 5711</span></div>
  <div style="font-family: &quot;Museo Sans For Dell Regular&quot;; font-size: 11pt; margin-bottom: 12pt; margin-top: 12pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0RP0HA">On Windows, Doradus can also be installed and managed as a service using the Apache Commons Daemon component. See </span><span style="color: #0000FF; text-decoration: underline;">[[http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-daemon/procrun.html|http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-daemon/procrun.html]]</span> for more information.</div>
  <div style="font-family: &quot;Museo Sans For Dell Regular&quot;; font-size: 11pt; margin-bottom: 12pt; margin-top: 12pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0QP0HA">Doradus assumes that Cassandra is started independently. Doradus connects to Cassandra at the </span><span style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal;">dbhost</span> address(es) and <span style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal;">dbport</span> number defined in <span style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal;">doradus.yaml</span>. If no configured Cassandra nodes are available when Doradus starts, it will reattempt to connect every 30 seconds. Until a connection is successful, most REST API calls will return a <span style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal;">503 Service Unavailable</span> response.</div>
  <div style="font-family: &quot;Museo Sans For Dell Regular&quot;; font-size: 11pt; margin-bottom: 12pt; margin-top: 12pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0PP0HA">Doradus connects to Cassandra using the Thrift API, which has been tested with 1.2 versions. (Newer Cassandra versions and a switch to the CQL API are on the TODO list.)</span></div>
</div>
